main event: On August 3, 1952, at Kirtland AFB, New Mexico, a CAA ENGINEER observed three oblong translucent objects in inverted V formation tumbling and flip-flopping for nine minutes.
interesting points: The objects were described as translucent and in an inverted V formation, exhibiting unconventional maneuvers such as tumbling and flip-flopping.
The sighting occurred at 13500 ft with unknown distance north and 40 degrees above the horizon.
The observer was an engineer for CAAINIAC station, adding credibility to the report.
The observation took place under clear conditions with a near full moon and 30 miles visibility.
The report was sent to the Director of Intelligence HDARTS USAF, indicating its significance.
sighted object: three oblong translucent objects in inverted V formation
